title: First irregular discharge
vignette: A man notices an unusual bodily symptom once after an illness.

options.text: One symptom alone does not make him contagious; wait and see.
Any abnormal symptoms require immediate isolation.

title: Second sighting same day
vignette: Later that afternoon, a second symptom occurs.

options.text: Two symptoms establish infection status and require quarantine.
Only if seen on separate days does it count.

title: Symptoms caused by exertion
vignette: Heavy lifting seems to trigger the symptoms each time.

options.text: If due to exertion, he remains healthy.
Cause doesn't matter; repeated symptoms indicate infection.

title: Touching food while contagious
vignette: Before realizing his status, he handled baskets of produce.

options.text: The food becomes contaminated and must be discarded.
Only if he actually felt unwell at the time would it transmit.

title: Seat contamination
vignette: He sat on a stone bench in the town square during his contagious period.

options.text: Anything he sits on becomes a source of contamination.
Public benches remain safe to avoid communal hardship.

title: Questionable third symptom
vignette: A small sign may or may not be a new symptom.

options.text: Treat doubt as a full symptom and continue isolation.
Ignore uncertain signs and assume no new symptoms.

title: Treatment before sunset
vignette: He completes his seven days and gets treatment just before nightfall.

options.text: Treatment counts even minutes before sunset.
Better to wait until morning to be sure.

title: Carrying objects while contagious
vignette: During the quarantine days he carries packages for work.

options.text: Objects he carries become contaminated regardless.
Only items he directly touches are affected, not what he merely moves.

title: Entering the medical facility area
vignette: He accidentally steps onto the medical facility grounds while still contagious.

options.text: He must get medical clearance once recovered.
Since it was an accident, apology suffices.

title: Reinfection during recovery
vignette: On day five he experiences another symptom.

options.text: The recovery period resets from the beginning after each new symptom.
Only three consecutive days restart the count.

title: Shared riding saddle
vignette: A friend unknowingly uses his saddle soon after he rode it.

options.text: Anything he sits or lies on transmits infection to others.
Transmission requires direct contact with fluids, not just seating.

title: Bodily fluid contact
vignette: While talking, droplets from his mouth land on a neighbor's coat.

options.text: Saliva from a contagious person conveys infection and requires washing.
Such minor spray is negligible and ignored.

title: Reusing contaminated clothing
vignette: After recovery he wants to keep the garments worn during infection.

options.text: They can be laundered and reused normally.
Better to burn them to remove any doubt.

title: Touching restricted materials
vignette: He helps prepare restricted materials despite still in recovery.

options.text: A contagious person must avoid restricted materials entirely.
He may assist if careful not to contaminate them directly.

title: Final medical clearance
vignette: After treatment he delays getting the required medical clearance.

options.text: He remains contagious until the clearance is obtained.
Treatment alone suffices; the clearance may come later.
